content:
本件保存七年
C2-62- 1724
June 1, 2
MEMORANDUM
To : Mr. H. T. Potter Supply Advisor, US AID/C
From : C. C. Chang Original signed by Chief, Second Division C. C. Chang
Subject : Excess Equipment
Project No. Y-99-AX (99-471)
Referring to your memo MC-3860 dated May 28, 1962, we wish to offer the following comments:
(1) JGWhite have stated in the attached lists that White Engineering recommends that action be initiated to acquire the listed items.
(2) That CUSA requests Mission to initiate necessary action for acquisition and shipment to Taiwan indicates CUSA's approval te the acquisition of the listed items.
(3) On account of the uncertainty of the availability of excess items, time required to get them delivered and the requirements at the time of delivery, the recipient agencies indicated at the time of request are tentative. Upon delivery of the excess equipment to Taiwan, they will be allocated normally to the agencies originally intended and may occasionally be allocated to meet other urgent project requirements. Therefore, if available and deli- vered to Taiwan, the crane referred to in your letter will be allocated to either KillB or KsHB upon consideration of their requirements at that time and may be allocated to meet other urgent project requirement if the circumstances at that time warrant.
E-16.13.2
國史馆 Academia Historica
51. 3. 100×200

paragraphs.content: To : Mr. H. T. Potter Supply Advisor, US AID/C
From : C. C. Chang Original signed by Chief, Second Division C. C. Chang
Referring to your memo MC-3860 dated May 28, 1962, we wish to offer the following comments:
(1) JGWhite have stated in the attached lists that White Engineering recommends that action be initiated to acquire the listed items.
(2) That CUSA requests Mission to initiate necessary action for acquisition and shipment to Taiwan indicates CUSA's approval te the acquisition of the listed items.

(3) On account of the uncertainty of the availability of excess items, time required to get them delivered and the requirements at the time of delivery, the recipient agencies indicated at the time of request are tentative. Upon delivery of the excess equipment to Taiwan, they will be allocated normally to the agencies originally intended and may occasionally be allocated to meet other urgent project requirements. Therefore, if available and deli- vered to Taiwan, the crane referred to in your letter will be allocated to either KillB or KsHB upon consideration of their requirements at that time and may be allocated to meet other urgent project requirement if the circumstances at that time warrant.
